title: Supreme Court Ruling on Union Fees Is a Limited Blow to Labor

abstract: A theater critic imagines a clash of the greatest versions of Shakespeares melancholy prince, as portrayed by John Barrymore, Laurence Olivier, Richard Burton and others.
author: By BEN BRANTLEY

abstract: Radical shifts in tactics have swept the field  even calling on officers to rush toward shooters without backup.
author: By ERIK ECKHOLM
title: Shootings Redefine Beat of School Police Officers

abstract: After 27 years of holding out, Alamo style, against rising rents and marching chain stores, the Rodeo Bar on the corner of Third Avenue and East 27th Street closed on Sunday.
author: By NATE SCHWEBER
copyright: Robert Stolarik for The New York Times
title: With Rent Up, Its Quittin Time for a Honky-Tonk

abstract: Accused of hobbling ethics investigations by the Moreland Commission, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo insisted that his office had merely offered advice.

copyright: Dominic Nahr for The New York Times
title: Defiant, Cuomo Denies Interfering With Ethics Commission

abstract: Russian officials condemned and belittled the sanctions, saying they would serve to strengthen its economy but would just make a sour diplomatic atmosphere worse.

abstract: The Ruxton seemed destined for greatness in 1929, but the company that made the car fell apart. In August, the Pebble Beach concours is expected to display at least 15 of the cars.

copyright: Michael Stravato for The New York Times
title: Remembering the Ruxton

abstract: Riyadh al-Adhadh, the Sunni president of Baghdads provincial council, returned home on Saturday after he was released by Shiite militiamen.

abstract: Robinson Canos power numbers are down, but his batting average is up with the offensively challenged Mariners.

abstract: Julius Towers found an apartment to buy in South Central Harlem.

abstract: Subjects include saving trees from dog urine, a landlords ban on air-conditioners, and an ugly tangle of abandoned cable lines.

abstract: The pen has finally met its demise, losing out to finger and the touch screens it controls.

abstract: An appeals court last week upheld a state law signed in 2011 that made it illegal for doctors to ask patients that question.

abstract: In a new book, two professors of family law chronicle the economic factors that are eroding old definitions of the family.

abstract: Fighting between rebels and the Ukrainian military forced an investigative team to retreat before it could secure the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 and begin an investigation into the circumstances of the crash.

title: Officials Pull Back From Crash Site as the Army Puts Pressure on Rebels

abstract: It's no wonder we're the country of favelas, and houses of cardboard and tin.

abstract: Scandals keep occurring, even after the financial crisis, raising the uncomfortable possibility that the industry is fundamentally flawed.

abstract: The OSI Group, one of the top meat producers in the United States with more than $6 billion in sales and about 20,000 employees in 17 countries, is enveloped in a food safety scandal in China.

abstract: An increase in inventories is a big part of the story, but that doesnt tell us much about the future of the economy.
